column4: anybody some advice aon compiling gchempaint? I wish I could just apt-get it :(
one tip, compile things with checkinstall. it tuns the finish product into a .deb and automatically installs it, makes it easier to manager (and remove)
I just wish there was a usable ubuntu-package for gchempaint, it looks so damn good, just no way for me to use it :( (waaaay to many dependency's unable to meet)

launch a tabbed x terminal and launch your apps from that :P
good one !
basically you can use bg and fg (background and foreground), and jobs and &
you'll figure it out, just use bg to resume apps you paused with ctrl+z
ctrl+z + bg # is what you use if you forgot to use &
